#T_RL=webanno.custom.Coref|type|BT_webanno.custom.Referent
#Text=Septic Tank Sam
#Text=Septic
#Text=Tank
#Text=Sam
#Text=is the nickname given to an unidentified murder victim who was found in a septic tank thirteen kilometers west of Tofield , Alberta .
#Text=Authorities suspect he was n't from Alberta , but most likely worked as a migrant worker . [ 1 ]
#Text=Discovery
#Text=Sam was found wearing a blue Levi shirt with snap buttons , a gray t-shirt , blue jeans , and imitation Wallabee shoes .
#Text=His decomposed body was wrapped in a yellow bed sheet and tied up with a nylon rope .
#Text=Sam was found by a local couple scavenging their abandoned property for a septic tank pump .
#Text=After seeing his leg bobbing in their old septic tank , they alerted the Tofield Royal Canadian Mounted Police ( RCMP ) detachment .
#Text=Two officers came to the scene to recover Sam 's body , where they spent an hour emptying the 1.8 meter deep septic tank with empty ice cream pails . [ 2 ]
#Text=Autopsy
#Text=A medical examiner in Edmonton determined Sam to be of European Canadian descent .
#Text=His bones and teeth suggested he suffered from an unspecified illness at five years old .
#Text=Sam 's cause of death was two gunshots to the head and chest , although it was possible there could 've been more if any of the bullets did n't reach his skeleton .
#Text=Before his death , Sam had been tortured ; he 'd been beaten , tied up , burned with a small butane torch and cigarettes , and sexually mutilated with farm shears .
#Text=The sexual mutilation was so severe that the medical examiner took several months to positively identify him as a male .
#Text=Based on the burn marks on his shirt sleeves , Sam could 've been tied to a bed while tortured .
#Text=After Sam 's death , he 'd been covered in quicklime , most likely in an attempt to quicken decomposition . [ 3 ]
#Text=Investigation
#Text=Due to a lack of evidence in the septic tank , Sam was most likely murdered elsewhere and the septic tank was only a dumpsite .
#Text=Sam 's murderers are believed to have known him , due to how viciously he 'd been killed .
#Text=It 's also suspected Sam 's murderers were Tofield locals or were familiar with the area . due to the location of Sam 's dumpsite being on a rural property . [ 2 ]
#Text=Sam 's body has been exhumed from his unmarked grave in an Edmonton cemetery twice .

#Text=In 1979 , Sam 's remains were flown out to Clyde Snow and Betty Gatliff , Forensic anthropologist and medical illustrator at the Federal Aviation Administration in Oklahoma who 'd been creating 3D facial composites from skulls since 1967 .
#Text=Along with creating a facial composite for Sam , the two could tell by measuring his hands that he was right handed .
#Text=Snow believed Sam to be of Indigenous origin and around 35 years old , contradicting the RCMP 's belief of Sam being a European Canadian and between 26 to 32 . [ 2 ]
#Text=Sam was exhumed and reconstructed for the second time in 2000 by Cyril Chan , who was with the Edmonton medical examiner 's office at the time . [ 2 ]
#Text=Aftermath
#Text=The 1,200 residents of Tofield at the time were horrified to hear of Sam 's murder .
#Text=Farmers checked their own septic tanks for bodies and business owners worried that Sam 's murderers could 've been regular customers .
#Text=Many speculated Sam had been sexually mutilated due to committing a sex crime or being unfaithful in a relationship .
#Text=Ed Lammerts , one of the officers who helped recover Sam 's body , has since retired .

#Text=He believes Sam will never be identified , despite sending X-rays of Sam 's teeth to 800 Albertan dentists coupled with publishing them in dental magazines , and spending $ 1,000,000 CAD on the case . [ 4 ]
